conbody.p: The documentation generation feature provides a speedy way to create documents that describe how the application is designed. This feature generates a large number of files that is extracted from Design Studio models information to be integrated into the final document(s). A final document is a Microsoft Office Excel or Word artifact, while most documents generated by Design Studio are HTML files. Microsoft Office supports inserted links of HTML files.

The author of the final documentation is you. Design Studio does not generate or propose any structure or advice on how a document must be built. You choose the template for the document you need to produce, and you write all chapters describing the business context. You also make the final decision about which part of the generated documentation to include in the document and where to merge the written chapters.

the whole project
a package only
a single model This applies to all types of models that the documentation generates. Generated files can be filtered from the project properties. The final documentation needs to be up-to-date, reflecting the situation of real models. This is done by generating the documentation and refreshing the final document with new model extracts in a single command.

When generating modules, the part of the model designed in fragments are considered part of the module itself. The generated documentation does not detail inclusions of fragments inside a module. Furthermore, the generated documentation contains labels and column headers in English that cannot be translated.
